channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Simple router with AngularJS
item.description: Not Perl, but it was originally published on the Perl Maven site and if you are interested in the full course, it will be given at YAPC::NA.

item.title: Refactoring large test suite - separating data from code
item.description: This screencast is part of the Testing series.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: 2016.10 EnchantÃ©!
item.description: In the new things this week in Perl 6-land: one of the good introduction tutorials to Perl 6 is now available in French and German.

item.title: Reviving WWW::Shorten
item.description: Last summer, WWW::Shorten was put up for adoption. And now, happy news, somebody answered the call. New releases are already trickling in.

item.title: It's never too late to find a bug
item.description: Some bugs are easy to spot. Others can be sneaky. Blending with their surrounding, waiting patiently for years before the right circumstances present themselves. The present tale is about a bug of the latter category, which stayed dormant for over five years before resurfacing...

item.title: No more dirty reads with MongoDB
item.description: Perhaps you are the type of conservative soul who prefers consistency over sheer performance? Rejoice, for MongoDB has a new knob to adjust its behavior in that regard.

item.title: Son of MacPorts openssl versus Perl
item.description: A quick follow-up on Tom's original blog entry on the woes of having openssl and Perl play nice together on MacOS.

item.title: Munging lcpan text output with 'td'
item.description: Even if you don't use lcpan, this is a nice entry also showcasing cli tools to manipulate and report JSON-like data.

item.title: Running mixed Perl 5 and Perl 6 tests.
item.description: One of the oft-forgotten things about the t/ directory and 'prove' is that tests don't necessarily need to be Perl code. Here Pawel shows how one can painlessly mix and match Perl 5 and Perl 6 tests in a testsuite.

item.title: Frameworks don't make much sense
item.description: Reading this piece, the expression "Go Big, or Go Home" comes to mind. Peteris argues that frameworks are bad. What framework? _All_ of them.

item.title: Continuous Delivery for Libraries?
item.description: While the blo entry itself is more of a blurb, it contains links to the presentation Moritz gave on the topic at the German Perl Workshop and to his book-in-progress.

item.title: YAPC::NA Tutorials
item.description: A preliminary list of YAPC::NA's tutorial is now available.

item.title: ZipRecruiter is sponsoring the QA Hackathon
item.description: Hot from the presses: the QA Hackaton has a new sponsor.

item.title: Call For Grant Proposals (March 2016 Round)
item.description: The Perl Foundation is launching its round of grant proposals for March. Deadline: March 23rd.

item.title: #242 - Thirty Score Subscribers, WOOHOO!
item.description: This week, we're celebrating our 6,000th subscriber! And in 8 weeks we'll be hitting our 250th edition. And 10 weeks after that, it's the 5th anniversary (really?) milestone that we'll reach. I don't know about you, but I'd say that all those occasions call for a momentous celebratory camel cake. Enjoy! (this edition of the PerlWeekly, that is, not the yet-to-be-baked cake) ~ `/anick
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
